intro: Leucocnide sororia, commonly known as the white-flowered climbing vine, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its slender, twining stems and heart-shaped leaves that are typically dark green. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its fruit is a small, fleshy capsule that contains several seeds. Leucocnide sororia thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests.
